item.text: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent. (consideration: CR S5451; text as passed Senate: CR S5451; text of measure as introduced: CR S5449)

Passed/agreed to in Senate: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.(consideration: CR S5451; text as passed Senate: CR S5451; text of measure as introduced: CR S5449)

summary.text:
Authorizes the display in the Senate Lobby of portraits in the Senate Leadership Portrait Collection at the direction of the Senate Commission on Art in accordance with specified prescribed guidelines.

Provides that such Collection shall consist of portraits, selected by the Commission, of Majority or Minority Leaders and Presidents pro tempore of the Senate.

Requires any portraits acquired for such Collection on or after the date of adoption of this resolution to be of an appropriate size for display in the Senate Lobby, as determined by the Commission.

(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

Authorizes the display in the Senate Lobby of portraits in the Senate Leadership Portrait Collection at the direction of the Senate Commission on Art in accordance with specified prescribed guidelines.

Provides that such Collection shall consist of portraits, selected by the Commission, of Majority or Minority Leaders and Presidents pro tempore of the Senate.

Requires any portraits acquired for such Collection on or after the date of adoption of this resolution to be of an appropriate size for display in the Senate Lobby, as determined by the Commission.

bill.title: A resolution to authorize the display of the Senate Leadership Portrait Collection in the Senate Lobby.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
